Labeling Items

If you are dealing with an item or set of items that you want to group together, you can create a new revision label, attach an existing label to the item or an item revision, review all labels, or move a revision label.

To create a new revision label for selected items:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select one or more items from the upper pane.

  4. Select Labels > New from the component or context menu. The Attach a New Revision Label dialog opens.

  5. Enter a name and description for the label in the appropriate text boxes. The maximum label name length is 64 characters and the description length is 254 characters.

  6. (Optional) To ensure that only the selected item revision can have this label, select the Frozen check box.

  7. Indicate what item revision is to receive this label by selecting a configuration option button. Your choices are:

    • Current configuration to attach the label to the tip revision.

    • Labeled configuration to attach the label to the revision with a specified label. The labels are in reverse chronological order based on the time at which they were created.

    • Promotion state configuration to attach the label to the revision currently in a specified promotion state. (Actually, the label is attached to the revision that has the promotion state’s current view label.)

    • Configuration as of to attach the label to the revision that was the tip revision at a specified date and time.

  8. Click OK.

To attach an existing view or revision label to selected items:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select one or more items from the upper pane.

  4. Select Labels > Attach from the component or context menu. The Attach a Label dialog opens. This dialog lists all existing labels and identifies them as view or revision labels. By default, both the View labels and Revision labels check boxes are selected.

  5. To limit the list to a specific type of label, clear the appropriate check box.

  6. Select a label from the list.

  7. Click OK.

To attach an existing view or revision label to a specific item revision:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select the item from the upper pane.

  4. Select the Label tab. This action displays the Label pane, which lists all item revisions.

  5. Right-click an item revision, to display the context menu.

  6. Select Attach from the context menu. The Attach a Label dialog opens. This dialog lists all existing labels and identifies them as view or revision labels. By default, both the View labels and Revision labels check boxes are selected.

  7. To limit the list to a specific type of label, clear the appropriate check box.

  8. Select a label from the list.

  9. Click OK.

To review all labels attached to item revisions:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select an item from the upper pane.

  4. Select the Label tab. This action displays the Label pane, which shows all revisions for the item. Right-clicking a revision displays all of its labels.

To move a revision label from one item revision to another:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select an item from the upper pane.

  4. Select the Label tab. This action displays the Label pane, which shows all revisions for the item.

  5. Right-click a revision to display all of its labels.

  6. Select a specific label and drag it from one revision to another.

    7. Note: Remember that a label can be attached to only one revision of an item.

For additional information, see Deleting Labels and Selecting Items by Label.
